website_summaries.verdict: The Denon AH-D1100s sound great, and they're incredibly light and comfy. If you're looking for a great set of all-rounders, we reckon they're worth the money.
With a simple design, but superb audio quality, fans of strong-but-not-overwhelming bass response will love Denon's comfortable AH-D1100 headphones.
pros: Extension cable and jack adapter included
cons: Enhanced bass response may turn off audiophiles seeking flat response
Comes with pouch rather than case

customer_reviews.title: That glorious Denon sound.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of Denons. They sound very much like the global cruisers, which was a beautiful sounding headphone (with very mediocre active noise cancellation btw). Whatever Denon is doing with this v signature seems to be exactly where my ears and brain like to listen to ambient and edm. I have far more expensive headphones that will probably just collect dust now (provided this somewhat flimsy build quality can hold up). Btw they also look very understated, the cups are extremely deep and go fully around the ear (learn something, B&O), and seal phenomenally well.
customer_reviews.author: EY

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience or bad design
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers on the performance of these headphones overall. They sounds great and are pretty comfortable. Unfortunately, about 4-5 months of ownership the small pieces of plastic that old the ear cups onto the headband began to fracture and break. Sadly I took a gamble on these and bought them used, so the warranty does not apply. The manufacturer's repair center charges $65 to ESTIMATE the repair cost and the manufacturer parts center doesn't even carry the part needed. So basically I ended up with trash. As a result I cannot recommend these or any Denon products.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Denon baby!
customer_reviews.text: If you like a bassier sound without having to have your cans driven by a headphone amp these are great. I use these for gaming(XBOX360), music and movies. They give me great spatial awareness when playing games. Music is full and rich throughout the gamut of genres and movies sound great plugged into my Denon 2309 receiver. They are easy to wear for hours on end and the sound they produce does not produce fatigue. Only had these for a couple weeks so I expect these to break in and sound even better. Denon makes quality products and their warranty service is bar none if you ever need it.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Rich

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is great! However
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great! However, the quality of the plastic holding the housing needs improvement. I am very careful with my things and it still managed to break. In addition, the connection inside the silver plastic for the tip didn't last much longer than a year and a half. Luckily, it came with an extension cord, so I was able to cut the original cord and the extension and put them together. But I guess for the price and the amazing sound quality I was happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sacarmiche

customer_reviews.title: Denon AH-D1100 Advanced Over-Ear Headphones (Black)
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They sound excellent. I also have the audio technica 700 which are more clear but doesn't have as much bass as the denon's. If you like music like I do, don't hesistate to pick these up. I take care care of all my things and somehow i cracked the piece that holds the earpiece. Be careful. Get a hard case. The headphones do not fold flat like the audio technica's. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bd4legacy

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones that break too easily
customer_reviews.text: After 2.5 years of mild use, the C-bracket broke just like other reviewers have reported. They have wonderful sound but are just not durable. I taped the bracket and will search for another brand. Definitely do not recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Top Cat

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Materials
customer_reviews.text: The sound is ok ... a little on the boomy side. But they are very cheaply constructed. Maybe they did it for weight; but the holder for the earpiece was so flimsy that it snapped in half after about a month of normal use. These are really crap.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Kasey

customer_reviews.title: better than home theatre !!
customer_reviews.text: i was looking for a nice pair of earphones that offered a great sound, checked out the beats, but the bass was too thick, these denons were awesome, these actually have a better sound quality than my home theatre, man they pick up every sound, even better than the movies which is why i bought them, mainly for movie enjoyment, but these puppies will do games, music, whatever your intrest in them is just as well, ive never been dissapointed with the denon product line, and once again they totally impress me.
customer_reviews.author: Z. galvins

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Build
customer_reviews.text: I own a pair of headphones from Denon that were built cheap. The hardware that holds the ear piece is made of plastic and in less than 8 months of ownership, both sides have broken. I would strongly caution anyone deciding on a Denon headphone to consider otherwise. The model I own is the ah-d1100 with a price of 200.00, so I would have expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great but cheap build quality
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great especially for the price and very comfortable too. They break easily though because they are made of cheap plastic. Mine broke somehow and I don't even know how it happened.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: I love these comfortable headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are incredibly comfortable. I'm a computer programmer and wear headphones for hours at a time. These never bother me. They were a little tight on my head for the first couple weeks but now feel perfect. It's worthy to note that I have a huge head and these cans probably wouldn't ever feel tight on 95% of the human population. The sound is great. They have good bass without any distortion. These are made solid as well. With my old Bose headphones I always felt like they were going to snap (which they did and is why I got these). These are sturdy and I don't worry about them one bit. Great work, Denon!
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good pair of Headphones to listen to music on my laptop. I read the review in PC Magazine and trusted the reviewer. I was going to get the $300 Bose headphones. I tried them out at a store and the Denons beat them hands down. i used cheaper headphones on my laptop and thought the sound card was not very good. I put the Denons in and it blew my away.I never heard music sound so good through a pair of headphones. I would recommend them to all they are well worth the money. The AH-D1100 Headphones are Great.
customer_reviews.author: Edward C Hecht

customer_reviews.title: Have had Beats by Dre, and prefer these.
customer_reviews.text: Beats by Dre sound okay, but they're quite bass heavy. These headphones are just simply clear and precise. Nothing is overwhelming and the sound is in perfect harmony. With the Beats the bass drowned out everything else but with these you hear everything perfectly. Plastic headband is somewhat cheap but well made, bought these for 200$ a year ago and was a good deal, now for 100$ they're a damn good steal
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Well...
customer_reviews.text: They are some pretty awesome headphones if you have an amplifier. I use a little mini amp that I carry with me. The highs aren't very beautiful. And the "s" sound is really exaggerated. They bleed sound tremendously.(even without the amp). They are perfect for gaming or movies or listening to music at home.
customer_reviews.author: neophyte27

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed garbage
customer_reviews.text: Got them in July. Loved the sound. Sometimes could get a little hot wearing them but they were very comfortable. Notice how Im talking about them in the past tense? Yeah they are already broken. See the grey y arms that hold the ear pieces? Those are made of very flimsy plastic. Under normal use in my home (I listened to my ipad while I played video games) they lasted about a month and a half. Not a very good bargain imo regardless of the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: C. Melton

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING audio quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these cans about 2 months back. The sound from these are superb. I've listened to the bose QC15s before and to me these sound better than the qc15s. Bass is a little bit overwhelming but deep. Mids are also good and the treble is not that warm but warm enough to enjoy the music. overall, these cans deliver awesome sound for an awesome price!
customer_reviews.author: Chathura Sankalpa cWijewardena

customer_reviews.title: Cheap frame. Broke easily.
customer_reviews.text: They sound great, but the plastic frame is cheap and broke on me. For this kind of money, they need better materials. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Bugs

customer_reviews.title: After much research
customer_reviews.text: This set is everything I had hopped for. Strong clear tight bass,Distinct separation of each instrument, wide sound stage effect,Well represented mids and crystal clear highs. These phones do not need an amp like so many others. I like using an EQ. itunes EQ works fine but for utube exploring I found a small older stereo amp and a small EQ that sounds great off my earphone jack on my mac book. Also these drivers can play very loud without any distortion. Needless to say I Highly recommend these light weight, quieting, 32ohm Advanced Headphones.I also like the two (long and short) slinky silicone cords.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Guaranteed to break
customer_reviews.text: Plastic arms crack and break. Don't buy this product. Lesson learned: Pay attention to reviews carefully. I did not and regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F. Salisbury

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Just Amazing
customer_reviews.text: By far the best pair of headphones I have ever owned. The quality seems flimsly but is actually very sturdy, and light too. The comfort is great. I have worn it for hours on end without getting sore from the cans. The sound is just absolutely amazing, especially if you are listening to FLAC quality tracks. It is probably one of the most balanced headphones I have used. Any genre sounds great. If you are looking for a set of headphones, this is it. It is very much affordable, and it will definitely be worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.author: Aznbadger

customer_reviews.title: plastic frame broke with less than frequent use making the headphones useless
customer_reviews.text: great sound and I thoroughly loved them for 9 to 10 months then the plastic frame that holds the earpieces broke on each side
customer_reviews.author: F. PAUL OLD, JR.

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a couple sets of headphones (Bose OE, SRH840, ATH-M50, HD650) before finding these. And I have to say these are my favorite headphones. They are fun, they have great bass, the highs are just how I like them and the mids aren't as recessed as other closed headphones. I will say this, they probably aren't true audiophile headphones but if you're looking for some fun and GREAT sounding headphones I would definitely recommend getting these.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Vargas

customer_reviews.title: great headphones
customer_reviews.text: When I was looking for headphones I was stuck between these, the audio technica m50s and sennheiser 595? I felt the sennheisers didn't have enough bass for my taste and I also did not like how the sound leaked out from them so easily. The audio technicas were better but they are heavier than the denons and they don't feel as comfortable because the muffs on those dont go completely over your ear. All in all im happy with my choice and have no complaints on the denons. A bit of EQ tweaking does wonders on these!
customer_reviews.author: DHin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sound, poor construction
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is certainly good, however after a month or two of regular use, the plastic around the ear phones where they actuate laterally began to crack, and it was obvious it wasn't going to last much longer. Luckily it happened within a week before the deadline to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Pierce

customer_reviews.title: These phones were comfortable, lightweight and sounded terrific
customer_reviews.text: These phones were comfortable, lightweight and sounded terrific. The overall tonal balance was equivalent to a loudness button on a receiver. With a bit of equalization, however, the sound was excellent. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: arthur strzelecki

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: As many other posts have stated these headphones deliver great sound, are very comfortable, but the curved plastic arc around each earpiece has cracked on each side. After only months of use. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great, but plastic is cheap
customer_reviews.text: got broken on its own after 7 months of use. using it everyday in cubicle. Nothing extreme. Dissapointed. For this amount of money could be much better
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry

customer_reviews.title: Great sound cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: These sound great and are perfect for listing to music at work. Unfortunately after only a year of use the mall plastic bars supporting the ear pieces have broken. For this kind of money I would expect more reasonable construction.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Fox

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, but they simply do not last. These headphones are made out of some really shoddy plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Steele

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, low quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed.... I purchased about 2 months ago. Worked fine for about a month, then it started to become difficult for both earphones to work, the headset jack needed constant adjustments for the sound to work. Sometimes one side would work, sometimes both, and other times if would just be a muffled noise. Very inconsistent and fickle, these issues became progressively worse. On top of all that, the bracket that attaches the earphones the headband it made of cheap plastic, mine has already snapped without heavy use! So basically one earphone is not even connected to the unit! Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: After a month the piece holding the earphone cracked. And it is at my work's pc so I didn't carry it around. Sound is good just whished they made it more resistant
customer_reviews.author: Hernan Metaute

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very good headphones. I discovered something new in all my already heard songs thanks to these headphones. A good value for the money spent. A word also about Amazon. It has been the first time I bought on here and I must say that I've been really satisfied. In just 3 working days I received the item in Italy. Thanks. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Best earphones
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are comfortable & easy to wear for several hours. Sounds are fantastic & I don't disturb my wife when I crank the sound up.
customer_reviews.author: ashley robbins

customer_reviews.title: my opioion
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of headphone and first high end earphone, before this headphone I have used a few pairs of earphones and 1 koss headphone. The best sound earphone out of all them is a fake sennheiser cx550 (seriously). Compare to that earphone, Denon d1100 have a much better sound stage, the bass is tight and punchy, the mid is clear and clean, the treble is soft and clear, unlike the earphone-which can be very sharp and may hurt my ears sometimes. I'm really satisfied with the sound quality from this headphone. However, as a closed headphone, it gets really warm after a while, which is the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: mihu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: GREAT HIGHS AND MIDS WITH SOME OMPH IN THE LOWER END VERY LIGHT AND COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.author: Garrett K.

customer_reviews.title: Poor earpiece
customer_reviews.text: This headphone is a poor substitute for the one it is to replace. The audio is great but the comfort is poor. After about a half hour, I end up with pain around my right ear. The earlier model is much better.
customer_reviews.author: hdbluf

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding pair of headphones, but poor quality (hence the 3 stars). I've had my pair since 2012-2013, and the plastic began to crack within the first few months. I filled the area near the cracks with hot glue and they haven't cracked any more since. I've replaced the ear pads several times and they remain solid till this day. I'm sure if I hadn't filled the areas with hot glue they would have broken a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Castro

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Quality - Plastic broke within a few months
customer_reviews.text: One of the "earphones" snapped off while putting it on my (average sized) head only a few months after I purchased. As numerous other reviewers have noted, the thin plastic that connects the earphones to the headband is pathetic and will break just from putting the headphones on. They were never dropped or treated roughly. This happened a year or so ago, and I set the headphones aside, but just recently I needed some headphones, so I repaired the area that broke with some paper clips and superglue. This actually worked pretty well, but then a few days later the plastic on the other earphone broke. What a joke!
customer_reviews.author: Connor H.

customer_reviews.title: Almost excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have lived happily with the previous model, the AH-D1000, for years. Comfortable, light-weight and, to my ears, great sound. When they finally gave in I found their successor, the AH-D1100, the natural replacement. After several hours of listening the last few weeks I am still really pleased with the result. The reason they fall short of a five-star review is the fact that they are a little bit less comfortable than their predecessor was for long hours of listening. The sound is still great. The low frequencies are a little bit louder than before, but then I like that. All in all, great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Aage J. Barlund

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are great and they sound great and they are worth it ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great and they sound great and they are worth it but the problem is that they are not constructed as well as most people including me would like or even expect them to be. If they had a better material instead of the plastic then I would give it 5 stars for sounding awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Brian McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Built to break - ratehr sooner than later
customer_reviews.text: The sound is very nice. I'm no expert - my hearing is rather bad, and these headphones help me to understand everything much better. They fit well and do not cause an uncomfortable feeling even when worn for hours. But the material they use for the plastic arms is very weak, especially at the four points where greater stress is applied when pulling the headset over the head and ears. Even very careful handling has caused hairline cracks and worse - one arm is halway through. This is a product that should not be bought.
customer_reviews.author: W. Laun

customer_reviews.title: Holy moly these are good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at Fry's on a whim and holy crap they are good. Upgraded from a pair of Sony monitor closed-ear headphones. One thing to note about these is the frequency response: 5 - 45000 Hz, which is amazing. Most of the headphones on the market are only doing 20 - 20K. You can really hear the difference on the low end. They sound wonderful both on the computer and attached to my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Musical_Llama

customer_reviews.title: 3D-printed screwless repair set to replace your Denon AH-D1100's earcup holder forks!
customer_reviews.text: Dear All, This Denon AH-D1100 produces really nice sound with good basses and clear high tones. Unfortunately, it has a very weak build quality, especially the earcup holder forks. Therefore 4 starts My office colleague suffered exactly from the same problem, therefore I have designed and 3D printed a screwless repair set of earcup holder forks. If you have a 3D printer or have a friend who has one, grab few beer cans and visit him. Follow this link for STL files:  Enjoy, Cengiz
customer_reviews.author: Cengiz

customer_reviews.title: 2 pairs broken in under a year
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I both bought a pair of these about 10 months ago. Both are cracked where the headpiece holds the ear cups. I am not sure what sort of cheap plastic Denon is using, but it has happened to both pairs, bought brand new, in exactly the same places.
customer_reviews.author: southwick

customer_reviews.title: they're still in great condition. I treat my headphones well (evidently unlike ...
customer_reviews.text: After about 4 years of 3/4 times a week of use, they're still in great condition. I treat my headphones well (evidently unlike other buyers) as they have only the slightest evidence of cracking on the clamp. If you're going to be throwing them around outside of the case or handling them aggressively, then no don't buy these. But if you're going for sound (reduce bass genre/accordingly) get these.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo V.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds fine, but poor construction
customer_reviews.text: I've had these about a year and they sound just fine. But... I'm on my second pair because the plastic headset breaks. The 1-year warranty replaced the pair, but my second pair now has a crack in the plastic again. The mere design of the headset creates stress on the plastic, and it doesn't hold up well. Find a good pair of headphones that have metal or less stressful tension on the headset.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, not built to last.
customer_reviews.text: Typical of other reviews, the plastic cracks within light use over a few months. They sound great while they last, though. Overall? Garbage. What's the point if I can't enjoy them for over even a year?
customer_reviews.author: aHeroForEternity

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't matter how good you treat them
customer_reviews.text: They will snap and break. Doesn't matter how good you treat them, it'll only be a matter of time. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Draper

customer_reviews.title: Great BFYB
customer_reviews.text: Exceelent bass that is impressively clean, much more so than the "beats" type phones. Comfortable cuffs, but the plastic in the headband(under padding) is audible. Rolled of high's which is perfect for those who are sensitive to loud high pitched noise or suffer from tinnitus. I use these for music when I can't let my speakers roll and for late night movies on FIOS and blu-ray. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: soreshoulder

customer_reviews.title: Denon AH-D1100 vs. MT-50
customer_reviews.text: I have both Audio Technica ATH-M50 and D1100, I use my iPod to compare two headphones, Denon has more bass, and little too much of it, compare with M-50 sound much clear and the bass just right, I can hear the different sound of the high hat in the music, M-50 give much nature clean high hat sound, and D-1100 to me sound little fake on the high hat, the M-50 build quality is so much better than D-1100. Two things I like about the D-1100 is much lighter than M-50, and the ear cup is bigger.
customer_reviews.author: SMS

customer_reviews.title: unbelievable -best all around cans under $200
customer_reviews.text: These quickly became my favorite headphones they're extremely comfortable look great and just make me feel good when I listened to them
customer_reviews.author: tacos y burritos

customer_reviews.title: All Round Headphone
customer_reviews.text: The sound coming out at the beginning was a disaster. But after listening for 200hrs it became better and better. the bass is impressive which I really enjoy. And it is also great for pop songs. After long time wearing it, I did not feel any uncomfortable. BTW, if you do not have any amplifier. This one is definitely better than D2000 or D5000. Anyway, it is the best in such a price.
customer_reviews.author: St.Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for price
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't looking for incredible sound when I bought these, just wanted something that performed well, and these have definitely exceeded my expectations. Best part is that they have a shorter cord so they're easy to wear around the city. No need to wrap an super long cord around your hand. Highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: moniker15

product_meta.title: Denon AH-D1100 Advanced Over-Ear Headphones (Black)
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe AH D1100 sets a new standard for performance and value in over ear headphones. Part of Denon's "Acoustic Luxury" line, the AH D1100's are premium headphones suitable for the discerning music listener at home, and efficient enough for use "on the go" with portable music players. The AHD 1100 employ a newly designed 50mm driver featuring Denon's exclusive Microfiber diaphragm technology. This ultra lightweight radiating surface provides excellent dynamics and extended frequency response (5 37,000Hz) for crystalline clarity. The drivers are housed in precision Aluminum ear cups. To eliminate distortions and colorations caused by conventional sealed back enclosures, the AHD 1100 also features Denon's Acoustic Optimizer design. This improves low frequency extension and smoothes overall response by precisely adjusting the sound pressure balance behind and in front of the driver diaphragm. The adjustable headband features a new contour fit ergonomic design and is coupled to soft protein leather foam ear cushions providing comfortable isolation from outside sounds. This, and the unit's light weight (only 180 grams 6.3 ounces) ensures extended, fatigue free listening. The AH D1100 is equipped with an audiophile grade OFC oxygen free copper cable featuring equal length L/R design. A 3.5 meter extension cable is included along with a 3.5mm to 0.25" adapter and a convenient carrying pouch.
feature_bullets: Newly designed 50mm drivers use Neodymium magnets and feature Denon's exclusive Microfiber diaphragm technology
Precision Aluminum ear cups with new soft protein leather foam ear cushions
Denon's Acoustic Optimizer design improves low frequency extension and smoothes overall response by precisely adjusting the sound pressure balance behind and in front of the driver diaphragm
32 ohm impedence with 101dB/mW sensitivity mean these premium headphones can be successfully driven by portable music devices
Accessories include a 3.5m extension cable, a 3.5mm to 1/4" adapter jack and a soft cary pouch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars89 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
